travel_tip: The drive through Atlanta can have significant traffic. Try to time your travel through the city outside of peak rush hours (7-9 AM and 4-6 PM).

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~30% SoC. This 30-minute charge will get you comfortably to the major charging stop in Atlanta.

food_stops.name: Yamato Japanese Restaurant
food_stops.description: A local spot for a quick and satisfying hibachi or sushi meal.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~15% SoC. This is a great spot for a longer charge to 80-90% while you have a meal or rest overnight.

food_stops.name: Jai Ho Indian Kitchen
food_stops.description: Located in the popular Krog Street Market, offering authentic, chef-crafted Indian flavors.

food_stops.name: Poor Calvin's
food_stops.description: A highly-rated restaurant known for its unique fusion of Thai flavors with Southern comfort food.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~20% SoC. This is your main long charge. Getting to 90%+ here is ideal for the rest of the journey.

food_stops.name: Amar Indian Restaurant
food_stops.description: A buffet-style restaurant offering a wide variety of classic Indian dishes.

food_stops.name: Asahi Express
food_stops.description: A convenient spot for Japanese steakhouse fare and seafood.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~25% SoC. This is a quick top-off to ensure you arrive in Orlando with plenty of charge to navigate the city.

food_stops.name: Amrit Palace Indian Restaurant
food_stops.description: A long-standing local favorite known for its authentic cuisine and pleasant atmosphere.

food_stops.name: Asian Pop
food_stops.description: Offers a variety of Asian dishes and sushi in a friendly setting.

rest_areas.name: Marion County Welcome Center (TN)
rest_areas.location: Mile Marker 160 on I-24 E, Tennessee
rest_areas.description: A good first stop to stretch your legs before crossing into Georgia.

rest_areas.name: Georgia Rest Area #22
rest_areas.location: Mile Marker 179 on I-75 S, Georgia
rest_areas.description: A clean rest stop south of Atlanta to take a break.

rest_areas.name: Florida Welcome Center
rest_areas.location: Mile Marker 470 on I-75 S, Florida
rest_areas.description: The official welcome to the Sunshine State, offering free orange juice and travel info.

scenic_spots.name: Centennial Olympic Park
scenic_spots.description: A beautiful public park that was the centerpiece of the 1996 Olympics, surrounded by major attractions.

scenic_spots.name: Silver Springs State Park
scenic_spots.description: One of America's largest springs. Famous for its glass-bottom boat tours that showcase the crystal-clear water and aquatic life.

scenic_spots.name: Florida Horse Park
scenic_spots.description: A premier 500-acre equestrian facility in the 'Horse Capital of the Worldâ„¢', often hosting events.

kid_friendly_stops.name: Georgia Aquarium
kid_friendly_stops.description: One of the largest aquariums in the world, featuring incredible exhibits with whale sharks, dolphins, and beluga whales.

kid_friendly_stops.name: World of Coca-Cola
kid_friendly_stops.description: A fun museum showcasing the history of the famous beverage, with a popular tasting room featuring Coke products from around the globe.

kid_friendly_stops.name: Don Garlits Museum of Drag Racing
kid_friendly_stops.description: A fascinating stop for kids who love cars, showcasing the history of drag racing with over 300 vehicles on display.
